trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control is used as a container for other controls, especially when controls are generated programmatically.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control is parsed, and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class provides design-time support for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> controls in a visual designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> property gets the caption that appears on the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property gets the styles of the associated control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method sets collection elements to the string representations of various style attributes of the associated control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control or a copy of that control on the visual designer surface.
Adds string representations of style attributes to a collection to be used in the design-time rendering of the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> base method, which adds string representations of style attributes to the `styleAttributes` collection.
These attributes are based on the style properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> sets the direction of `styleAttribute` to a code indicating left-to-right or right-to-left, based on the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel.Direction%2A> property of the associated control.
A collection of style attributes implementing the <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref>.
Gets the caption that appears on the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> property returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel.GroupingText%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.
A string that contains the panel caption.
Gets the styles of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel"></xref> control.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> property is an empty string (""), the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property returns an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.

Otherwise, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property returns a default <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object that is generated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.FrameStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> base property.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object that contains the design-time styles for the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel"></xref> control.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

The visual designer calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.Initialize%2A> and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel"></xref>, which implements an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
component is not a or of a class derived from .
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel>.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.
Always `true`.
